• Apocalypse
  • Survival Plan
  • Self-test
  • Pop Culture

Test yourself

1. You wake up to find zombies have invaded your city: the news is talking about and you’ve found your neighbour in a less than desirable state. You decide it’s best to flee this pest-ridden hole of the undead. Perhaps your long-thought-dead uncle still has room in his remote cabin-in-the-woods, right? What’s the first thing you’re going to pack for the trip?

2. You flee down to the underground parking which has been left alone for the larger part. Some of your fellow residents have obviously already found their way out: the traffic gate has been rammed and several cars show damage as proof of hasty departure. You don’t own a car, but decide it’s best to steal one to get out of this hellhole. Which vehicle do you steal and what’s your reasoning?

3. Upon fleeing the scene, you are faced with gore, blood and entrails: it is clear some zombies have already feasted on some of your friendly next-doors. While slipping over the blood - depending on your means of transport it goes smoothly or rather clumsily – you notice the small pitter-patter footsteps and a bit farther you see the little boy that lived downstairs. He’s turned with his back towards you. His shoulders seem to be shaken. Could it be that he’s crying? What do you do?

4. Whatever you did, the boy obviously heard you nearby because it turns his little body towards you. His Disney T-shirt is covered in so much blood you can barely recognize Elsa from frozen. In his right hand, he’s holding what seems to be a finger. Judging by the elegant ring around the stump, it’s his mother’s…he simply never let go. When he opens his eyes, you can see that they are rolled into the back of his skull. It is clear that this child is no longer among the living. What do you do?

Author: Esa Denaux | esa.denaux@student.thomasmore.be
